intro: Galium squarrosum, commonly known as rough bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wet meadows, streambanks, and woodland edges. Galium squarrosum is typically herbaceous and can grow up to 30 inches tall, with hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, white pubescence.
